signs.title: COSMOS NEUTRAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product meets the requirements of the European COSMOS standard for natural cosmetics, developed by five organisations awarding environmental labels to cosmetics: BDIH from Germany, Cosmebio and Ecocert from France, ICEA from Italy and Soil Association from the UK.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>A product with this label contains no more than 5% of synthetic substances, and the remaining ingredients are based on natural raw materials. Apart from natural ingredients, the product may also contain ingredients of agricultural origin manufactured with organic methods (pursuant to the principles of organic farming) in the quantity specified in the description on the packaging.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and packaging waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: COSMOS ORGANIC
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product meets the requirements of the European COSMOS standard for organic (ecological) cosmetics, developed by five organisations awarding environmental labels to cosmetics: BDIH from Germany, Cosmebio and Ecocert from France, ICEA from Italy and Soil Association from the UK.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>In this product at least 95% of ingredients of agricultural origin subject to physical treatment (and at least 20% of all ingredients) have been manufactured in accordance with the principles of organic farming, which means that for their manufacture no mineral fertilizers or pesticides have been used and attention has been paid to soil fertility and well-being of animals. Moreover, the packaging has been designed with care for the environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and packaging waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: ECOCERT NATURAL COSMETIC
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product contains materials derived only from living animals. It was not tested on animals. Only compounds based on selected and non-hazardous substances were used as preservatives. At least a half of ingredients of the product of agricultural origin are the products of organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>In a product with this label at least 5% of all raw materials and at least 50% of raw materials of agricultural origin have been produced in certified organic farms, while observing the standards of organic farming (e.g. failure to use mineral fertilizers or pesticides, taking care of soil fertility and well-being of animals).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and packaging waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: ECOCERT ORGANIC COSMETIC
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product contains materials derived only from living animals. It was not tested on animals. Only compounds based on selected and non-hazardous substances were used as preservatives. Nearly all ingredients of the product of agricultural origin are the products of organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>In a product with this label at least 10% of all raw materials and at least 95% of raw materials of agricultural origin have been produced in certified organic farms, while observing the standards of organic farming (e.g. failure to use mineral fertilizers or pesticides, taking care of soil fertility and well-being of animals).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and packaging waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: PAO (Period After Opening)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label informs on the durability of cosmetic products. Inside the mark there is a number of months (M) or years (Y) given, during which the cosmetic is suitable for use, starting from its first opening. For example, 3M means that the cosmetic is suitable for use within the period of 3 months after first opening.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label allows for the rational use of cosmetics and helps to avoid the risk that they have expired, and thus prevents the generation of unnecessary waste. Additionally, it reduces the risk of health problems due to the application of a cosmetic no longer suitable for use.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label can be found on cosmetics, but also on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: GOODWEAVE
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label indicates that the product is made without the use of child labour.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be awarded to any products. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products. It can be found on packaging, food, cosmetics, textiles, construction materials, electronics and household appliances and toys.</p><br />

signs.title: PCT (VOLUNTARY CERTIFICATION)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has been tested with successful results and meets technical requirements and quality and safety standards specified in GOST norms. A voluntary GOST R certificate does not substitute for the mandatory GOST R.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>PCT label confirms that the manufacturer of the product obtained the voluntary certificate of conformity with GOST standards. GOST standards are documents applicable in the Russian Federation, established by the Federal Agency for Technical Regulation and Metrology ROSSTANDART.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>PCT label of voluntary certification can be awarded to any products; however, it shall not replace the mandatory GOST R certificate. This label can be also found on waste generated after the use of products subject to certification.</p><br />

signs.title: PCT (REQUIRED CERTIFICATION)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The  product has been tested with successful results and meets technical requirements and quality and safety standards specified in GOST norms. GOST R certificate is obligatory. It is required, inter alia, by the Russian customs authorities at the import of goods into the territory of the Russian Federation.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label of PCT obligatory certification confirms that the manufacturer of the product obtained the certificate of conformity with GOST standards. This label applies to certificates issued after 27 December 2010. GOST standards are documents applicable in the Russian Federation, established by the Federal Agency for Technical Regulation and Metrology ROSSTANDART.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>PCT label of obligatory certification includes selected groups of products. It can be found, inter alia, on beverages, special food, food additives, cosmetics, household chemicals, pesticides, hygiene products and selected products intended for contact with food. This label can be also present on waste generated after the use of products subject to certification.</p><br />

signs.title: PCT (REQUIRED CERTIFICATION)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has been tested with successful results and meets technical requirements and quality and safety standards specified in GOST norms. GOST R certificate is obligatory. It is required, inter alia, by the Russian customs authorities at the import of goods into the territory of the Russian Federation.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label confirms that the manufacturer of the product obtained the certificate of conformity with GOST standards. This label applies to certificates issued before 27 December 2010. GOST standards are documents applicable in the Russian Federation, established by the Federal Agency for Technical Regulation and Metrology ROSSTANDART.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>PCT label of obligatory certification includes selected groups of products. It can be found, inter alia, on beverages, special food, food additives, cosmetics, household chemicals, pesticides, hygiene products and selected products intended for contact with food. This label can be also present on waste generated after the use of products subject to certification.</p><br />

signs.title: RAINFOREST ALLIANCE VERIFIED MARK
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has been manufactured in accordance with the standards of the Rainforest Alliance. </p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>It is an information mark that confirms the legal origin of wood raw material and guarantees that the product does not contain raw materials from illegal logging.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to forest products (wood raw material) and products based on wood raw material, such as wood packaging, furniture, sawmill products.</p><br />

signs.title: CARBON NEUTRAL PRODUCT
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded by the organisation CARBON NEUTRAL and it is a confirmation that the product meets standards provided for in the document The CarbonNeutral Protocol. It means that the product has a neutral carbon balance and is environmentally friendly.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>WBenefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product does not contribute to the emission of greenhouse gases, which are considered to be the main source of global warming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to different product categories, which can include for example: construction products, cosmetics, electrical and electronic equipment, packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: LABEL IDENTIFYING THE TYPE OF PACKAGING MATERIAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label informs us that the packaging is made from a polymer called polystyrene (RPS) – number 5 or 05 from recycling (so-called recyclate).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The packaging is made from a secondary raw material, thus avoiding the need to use the primary environmental resources.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>What to do with</strong></p><br /><br /><p>After use, packaging with this label should be disposed to waste containers marked with the sign PLASTICS.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is of significant importance during the identification of packaging waste and while deciding about its future fate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: LABEL IDENTIFYING THE TYPE OF PACKAGING MATERIAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label informs us that the packaging is made from a polymer called polypropylene (RPP) – number 5 or 05 from recycling (so-called recyclate).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The packaging is made from a secondary raw material, thus avoiding the need to use the primary environmental resources.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>What to do with</strong></p><br /><br /><p>After use, packaging with this label should be disposed to waste containers marked with the sign PLASTICS.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is of significant importance during the identification of packaging waste and while deciding about its future fate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: LABEL IDENTIFYING THE TYPE OF PACKAGING MATERIAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label informs us that the packaging is made from a polymer called low-density polyethylene (RLDPE, RPE-LD) - number 4 or 04 from recycling (so-called recyclate).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The packaging is made from a secondary raw material, thus avoiding the need to use the primary environmental resources.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>What to do with</strong></p><br /><br /><p>After use, packaging with this label should be disposed to waste containers marked with the sign PLASTICS.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is of significant importance during the identification of packaging waste and while deciding about its future fate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: LABEL IDENTIFYING THE TYPE OF PACKAGING MATERIAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label informs us that the packaging is made from a polymer called polyvinyl chloride (RPVC or RV) – number 3 or 03 from recycling (so-called recyclate).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The packaging is made from a secondary raw material, thus avoiding the need to use the primary environmental resources.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>What to do with</strong></p><br /><br /><p>After use, packaging with this label should be disposed to waste containers marked with the sign PLASTICS.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is of significant importance during the identification of packaging waste and while deciding about its future fate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: LABEL IDENTIFYING THE TYPE OF PACKAGING MATERIAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label informs us that the packaging is made from a polymer called high-density polyethylene (RHDPE, RHD-PE, RPE-HD) - number 2 or 02 from recycling (so-called recyclate).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The packaging is made from a secondary raw material, thus avoiding the need to use the primary environmental resources.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>What to do with</strong></p><br /><br /><p>After use, packaging with this label should be disposed to waste containers marked with the sign PLASTICS.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is of significant importance during the identification of packaging waste and while deciding about its future fate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: LABEL IDENTIFYING THE TYPE OF PACKAGING MATERIAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Packaging made from a polymer called polyethylene terephthalate (RPET, RPETE, RPETP, RPET-P) – number 1 or 01 from recycling (so-called recyclate).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The packaging is made from a secondary raw material, thus avoiding the need to use the primary environmental resources.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>What to do with</strong></p><br /><br /><p>After use, packaging with this label should be disposed to waste containers marked with the sign PLASTICS.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is of significant importance during the identification of packaging waste and while deciding about its future fate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: LUOMU
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product with the label meets the environmental criteria of the certification of products conducted by the Finnish Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>A product with this label has been manufactured in an environmentally friendly manner, without the use of mineral fertilizers, while observing the natural circulation of substances in nature and while maintaining the well-being of plants and animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: OK COMPOST WATER
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product/packaging with this label can decay under the impact of living organisms (e.g. microorganisms) in fresh water.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product/packaging contributes to the reduction of waste volume in rivers, lakes and other types of fresh water.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>It does not mean that the product or packaging is suitable for decomposition in seawater.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Certificate</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The mark is the confirmation of the certificate of the AIB-Vinçotte Group.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: OK BIOBASED
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This mark confirms the presence of natural renewable raw materials in the final product or its packaging. Depending on the content volume of raw materials, the label can have different numbers of stars (* = 20-40% of renewable raw materials, ** = 40-60%, *** = 60-80%, **** = more than 80%).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The use of renewable raw materials is beneficial as it reduces the demand for non-renewable natural resources.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Certificate</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The mark is the confirmation of the certificate of the AIB-Vinçotte Group.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: OK COMPOST HOME
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees biodegradability of the product or its packaging in the household compost.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The term &quot;biodegradable&quot; is often used, however biodegradability depends significantly on the environment. Something that will decompose in an industrial composting plant will not always decompose under household conditions. The label is of significant importance during the identification of packaging waste and while deciding about its future fate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Certificate</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The mark is the confirmation of the certificate of the AIB-Vinçotte Group.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: RESY
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label proves that the packaging belongs to the RESY system. The system is based on the German packaging law and it is applied only to transportation packaging made from cardboard or paper.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>RESY symbol guarantees that the packaging may be recycled and that it will be subject to the collection carried out by organisations belonging to this system. Each member of RESY system receives an identification number, which is placed under the label.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: RoHS
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is the manufacturer&#39;s declaration that the product meets the required criteria of the ROHS Directive 2002/95/EC, on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The manufacturer declares that in the homogeneous material contained in the product there is no more than: <br />- 0.1% of lead<br />- 0.01% of cadmium<br />- 0.1% of mercury<br />- 0.1% of hexavalent chromium<br />- 0.1% of polybrominated biphenyls<br />- 0.1% of polybrominated diphenyl ethers.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: ENERGY STAR
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product meets the required criteria of the ENERGY STAR programme in terms of energy efficiency.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is a guarantee that the product meets the required criteria for energy.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: ENERGY SAVING RECOMMENDED
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is energy efficient and it consumes less energy compared to other similar products in the same product category.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Energy effectiveness means not only financial savings but also less demand for non-renewable natural resources and lower emissions of pollutants into the environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: EPEAT BRONZE
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has successfully completed the certification process under the EPEAT programme. BRONZE rating means that it meets all the required criteria and up to 50% of additional ones. Product marked with this label has been qualified at the third level in terms of environmental performance of certificates awarded under the EPEAT.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product on which it is placed has been designed in accordance with the principles of design for environment, taking into account the entire life cycle of this product. For its manufacture, materials with lesser environmental impact have been selected, it demonstrates an extended life, energy effectiveness and has been designed in such a manner that handling waste generated after its use has the least environmental impact.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: EPEAT SILVER
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has successfully completed the certification process under the EPEAT programme. SILVER rating means that it meets all the required criteria and 50-75% of additional ones - silver. Product marked with this label has been qualified at the second level in terms of environmental performance of certificates awarded under the EPEAT.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product on which it is placed has been designed in accordance with the principles of design for environment, taking into account the entire life cycle of this product. For its manufacture, materials with lesser environmental impact have been selected, it demonstrates an extended life, energy effectiveness and has been designed in such a manner that handling waste generated after its use has the least environmental impact.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: EPEAT GOLD
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has successfully completed the certification process under the EPEAT programme. GOLD rating means that it meets all the required criteria and 75% of additional ones - gold. Product marked with this label has the highest environmental performance of all possible rates (colours) awarded under the EPEAT.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product on which it is placed has been designed in accordance with the principles of design for environment, taking into account the entire life cycle of this product. For its manufacture, materials with lesser environmental impact have been selected, it demonstrates an extended life, energy effectiveness and has been designed in such a manner that handling waste generated after its use has the least environmental impact.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: EPEAT
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has successfully completed the certification process under the EPEAT programme and met all the required criteria.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product on which it is placed has been designed in accordance with the principles of design for environment, taking into account the entire life cycle of this product. For its manufacture, materials with lesser environmental impact have been selected, it demonstrates an extended life, energy effectiveness and has been designed in such a manner that handling waste generated after its use has the least environmental impact.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: FEDERAL ENERGY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (FEMP)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The electrical and electronic equipment demonstrates reduced energy consumption - due to its energy efficiency it has been approved by the FEMP (Federal Energy Management Program). </p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Reduction of the energy consumption is not only positive in economic terms, but also from the point of view of environmental protection. It contributes to the reduction in the consumption of non-renewable natural resources and reduction in the emission of pollutants into the air, water and soil.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: EU ENERGY LABEL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label shows the energy efficiency of equipment by means of colours and the corresponding letter scale (A-G). The least economical equipment is classified as class G, marked with a red stripe, while the most efficient one as class A, with a green stripe. Apart from the energy consumption, the scale may demonstrate other parameters relevant to the product, e.g. CO2 consumption or fuel efficiency. The A-G scale can be extended by three additional classes: A+, A++ and A+++, for the most effective products.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Due to the scale introduced, you can easily estimate the energy efficiency of the product.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: SKIN-TOLERANT TEXTILES
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has been tested medically and checked for toxicity.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>It is an additional assurance for the final consumer in terms of the naturalness for the skin.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label is awarded to textile products.</p><br />

signs.title: ECOLOGO
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The mark is a label awarded under the national eco-labelling scheme functioning in Canada.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Products with this label stand out in their product category by lower environmental impact and compliance with comprehensive environmental criteria concerning the entire product life cycle.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to different product categories, such as: packaging, electrical and electronic equipment, fuels and means of transport, furniture, cleaning agents, food products and construction materials.</p><br />

signs.title: CHINA ENVIRONNMENTAL LABELLING
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label awarded under the national system of eco-labelling functioning in the People&#39;s Republic of China.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Products with this label stand out in their product category by lower environmental impact and compliance with comprehensive environmental criteria concerning the entire product life cycle.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to a number of product categories, which can include, for example: electric and electronic equipment, batteries, paper products, beverages, toys, textiles, construction materials, sanitary ceramics and furniture.</p><br />

signs.title: RUGMARK
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label indicates that the product is made without the use of child labour.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: ENVIRONMENTÁLNE VHODNÝ PRODUKT
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product meets multi-faceted environmental criteria.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has a reduced negative impact on the environment due to the reduction of energy consumption and raw materials, and hazardous substances.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Reduced energy consumption is connected with lower consumption of non-renewable natural resources and lower emissions of pollutants into the environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: ECO SAFE
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The textile product bearing this label is safe for the health of the user in terms of its chemical, physical and mechanical properties.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that for the manufacture of a specific product no paints containing carcinogenic or allergenic compounds were used, and no other harmful substances were used, such as formaldehyde, phthalates or heavy metals. The product does not contain small elements posing a choking hazard or otherwise threatening the user&#39;s health and life.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: OE BLENDED STANDARD
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The textile product contains at least 5% of the certified organic cotton fibres, which may be combined with other fibres, including the conventional cotton.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Organic cotton in the product has been manufactured on plantations cultivated in an environmentally friendly manner, without the use of mineral fertilizers or pesticides.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: OE 100 STANDARD
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The textile product is entirely (100%) made based on certified organic cotton fibre and this applies both to fibres, yarn and to finished products.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Cotton in the product has been manufactured on plantations cultivated in an environmentally friendly manner, without the use of mineral fertilizers or pesticides.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: TRUSTWORTHY TEXTILES OEKO-TEX ® Standard 1000
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label means that the manufacturer of specific textile or fabric products has met the environmental requirements in the production process concerning six different modules: chemicals management, environmental impact, environmental management, quality management, social responsibility and occupational health and safety.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Manufacturers of products certified with this label respect the prohibition to use certain substances, conduct the water and sewage management properly and reduce emissions into the air, including noise emission.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: TRUSTWORTHY TEXTILES OEKO-TEX ® Standard 100plus
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product meets the combined requirements of two standards OEKO-TEX® 100 and STEP (formerly OEKO-TEX® 1000).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Textiles with this label do not contain legally banned and harmful substances and have been manufactured in compliance with the requirements concerning water and sewage management and reduction of pollutants emitted into the atmosphere.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: TRUSTWORTHY TEXTILES OEKO-TEX ® Standard 100
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is free from harmful substances in concentrations that have adverse impact on human health.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that for the manufacture of the product not many substances have been used that could have a negative impact on the environment and human health, such as, for example: pesticides, chlorophenols, formaldehyde, allergic dyes, prohibited azo dyes and heavy metals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: GREEN CRANE
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label awarded to products with a relatively lower environmental impact compared to similar products throughout the entire life cycle (from extraction and collection of product materials to production, distribution, use, consumption, disposal and recycling).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to textile products.</p><br />

signs.title: GLOBAL ORGANIC TEXTILE STANDARD (GOTS)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product meets stringent standards of the global GOTS system. These standards include processes from the raw material procurement, through spinning, knitting, weaving, dyeing, until the final production of clothing and household textiles made with organic fibre (such as organic cotton and organic wool).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Key requirements of GOTS include the prohibition of genetically modified organisms (GMOs), highly hazardous chemicals (e.g. azo dyes and formaldehyde) and child labour.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to textile products.</p><br />

signs.title: EKOLOGICKY ŠETRNÝ VÝROBEK, EKOLOGICKY ŠETRNÝ SLUZBA
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>It is the official environmental label functioning under the eco-labelling system of the Czech Republic. It is awarded to products or services distinguished by much lower environmental impact in their product category.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Awarding of the label to a product or service is connected with the compliance with comprehensive environmental criteria concerning various stages of the life cycle.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to different product categories, such as: construction materials, detergents, cosmetics, furniture, electric and electronic equipment, office supplies, services and textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: EKOTEX
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>A linen product bearing this label has been produced in harmony with nature, with respect for the environment and in compliance with the highest environmental protection standards.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is not modified genetically and during the manufacture the principle of full use of raw materials provided to the company was applied (waste-free production).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is used for textiles.</p><br />

signs.title: TÜV  RHEINLAND GREEN PRODUCT
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label is put on products with verified environmental performance, which are produced in the environmentally sustainable manner, are energy efficient and have an identified carbon footprint. Inspectors who verify these products take into account the following factors: avoidance of dangerous chemicals, recyclability and the use of recycled raw materials.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to different product categories, such as: electrical and electronic equipment, furniture, footwear, recreation and sports equipment and external devices.</p><br />

signs.title: UL ENVIROMENT’S ECOLOGO
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label indicates that the product has undergone rigorous tests of compliance with environmental quality standards based on environmental criteria concerning the entire product life cycle and such aspects as energy consumption, emission, content of secondary raw materials, etc.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to different product categories, such as: toys, electric and electronic equipment, cleaning agents, construction materials and furnishing materials.</p><br />

signs.title: ECO LABEL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This is one of the three labels reserved for PCBC S.A. awarded to domestic or foreign products and services which do not cause any adverse effects for the environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Products and services with this label meet the established criteria concerning the protection of health, environment and economic use of natural resources in the entire cycle of product life.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is placed on the product itself or on its packaging. It also includes such product categories as: toys, textiles, construction materials, cosmetics and electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: CE (CONFORMITÉ EUROPÉENNE )
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label is a confirmation that the product meets the requirements of the so-called New Approach Directives, i.e. it does not threaten the user&#39;s health and safety and it is safe for the environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>It is awarded to different categories of products, including: toys, electrical and electronic equipment, construction materials, medical devices, machinery, measuring instruments, explosives for civil use and pyrotechnics, means of water transportation, personal protective equipment, pressure devices, ATEX products, elevators. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of products with the label.</p><br />

signs.title: „e” Label
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The manufacturer of the product used the discretionary standard system for weight or volume control at the production stage.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The presence of the label on the packaging informs consumer that the actual weight or volume of the packed product is consistent with the value declared on the packaging.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label applies only to products, yet it is placed on the packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: SAFETY MARK B PCBC
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Safety label awarded by the Polish Centre for Testing and Certification means that the product does not pose a threat to life or health. It is environmentally friendly, provided that it is used in accordance with the conditions of use specified by the producer (manufacturer), e.g. in the manual.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging of dangerous goods. It is placed on the product itself, its packaging or in the technical documentation</p><br />

signs.title: SAFETY MARK B
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product meets safety requirements and technical requirements specified in relevant national and international standards.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded by independent authorized units and confirms that a specific product, provided that it is used in accordance with the principles specified by the manufacturer, e.g. in the manual, does not pose a threat to life, health, property and environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label applies to numerous different categories of products that can pose any threat. It is placed on the product itself, its packaging or in the technical documentation. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of products with the label.</p><br />

signs.title: UN
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The UN label has been introduced by the United Nations (Committee of Experts of the European Economic Commission) for the transport of dangerous goods, pursuant to the European Agreement concerning the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road (ADR). Packaged goods are classified to one of 13 classes of risks and are granted a four-digit UN number, which is placed at the label. This number corresponds to the dangerous properties of goods and based on that a relevant method of transport is selected, as well as proper packaging and procedures to ensure safety in normal conditions of road transport.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the packaging is adapted to the hazardous properties of packed goods and it ensures their safe protection.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging of dangerous goods.</p><br />

signs.title: FSC (FOREST STEWARDSHIP COUNCIL)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The wood or paper used for the manufacture of the product comes from forests certified in the FSC system. The label confirms the legality of the raw material origin.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>FSC® certificate is a guarantee that a raw material was used which was created in accordance with the principles of responsible forestry, conducted in such a manner as to balance the natural, social and economic aspects of forest management while respecting the rights of the present generation to use forest resources, and taking into account the needs of future generation.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to a broad range of products including forest raw materials, such as packaging, toys, paper office supplies.</p><br />

signs.title: PEFC (PROGRAMME FOR THE ENDORSEMENT OF FOREST CERTIFICATION SCHEMES)
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is made of certified forest raw material from forests managed in accordance with the principles of sustainable forestry, according to the environmental, social and economic standards of the PEFC.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>PEFC creates a mechanism that confirms that entities in charge of the management of forest resources and customers of wood and paper products promote sustainable forest management.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>PEFC is a global organisation established for the assessment and mutual recognition of national systems for certification of forest management, forest products and paper products.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to a broad range of products including forest raw materials, such as packaging, toys, paper office supplies.</p><br />

signs.title: TRADITIONAL SPECIALITY GUARANTED
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label is placed on a product or foodstuff whose composition, method of production or processing correspond to the traditional practice in relation to this product or which is made or raw materials or ingredients used traditionally.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The purchase of this product supports traditional methods of food production and processing.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: PROTECTED DESIGNATION OF ORIGIN
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label related to the name of the region, specific place or country - used to describe an agricultural product or a food product. The entire technological process, i.e. production, processing and preparation, is carried out in that specific geographical area.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Quality of the product or its characteristics shall be mainly or exclusively connected with this specific geographical environment and relevant natural and human factors. The purchase of this product supports food manufacturing and processing activities in a particular geographical area.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: PROTECTED GEOGRAPHICAL INDICATIONS
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label related to the name of the region, specific place or, in exceptional cases - used to describe an agricultural product or a food product that comes from that region, place or country.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has special, specific quality, reputation and is generally recognised or it has other characteristics attributable to its geographical origin.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>In the specified area one of the three processes can be held: production, processing or preparation of the product.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: NATURLAND
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Farmers and processors associated and operating globally under the organisation Naturland produce valuable food and products based on agricultural raw materials in accordance with Naturland standards concerning organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has been manufactured especially without the use of fertilizers and chemical pesticides. Products labelled with NATURLAND are environmentally friendly and contribute to the protection of jobs.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded mainly to food products, but it can also be present on cosmetics and textile products.</p><br />

signs.title: DEMETER
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>A product of biodynamic agriculture.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Product manufactured:<br />- without chemical fertilizers and chemical pesticides<br />- with the use of biological intensification.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded mainly to food products, but it can also be present on textile products.</p><br />

signs.title: BIOLAND
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>A product of modern agricultural production.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has been manufactured:<br />- without pesticides and chemical fertilizers<br />- in accordance with the principles of organic animal breeding and food processing.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Farmers and processors certified under the Bioland system act in harmony with nature, supporting biodiversity and protecting the environment and climate.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: BCS ÖKO-GARANTIE
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is of high quality and was produced without the use of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides, and the conservation of biodiversity and ensuring adequate living conditions of farm animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: ASSOCIATION OF LATVIAN ORGANIC AGRICULTURE- ALOA
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is of high quality and is made in accordance with the principles of organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product was manufactured without the use of synthetic mineral fertilizers and pesticides and while preserving biodiversity and ensuring adequate living conditions of farm animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: AIAB
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is made in accordance with the principles of sustainable development and organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product was manufactured without the use of synthetic mineral fertilizers and pesticides and while preserving biodiversity and ensuring adequate living conditions of farm animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: AGROBIO
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is made while observing the basic principles of organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>No synthetic mineral fertilizers or pesticides were used to manufacture the product. The manufacture was made while preserving biodiversity and ensuring adequate living conditions for farm animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is used for food and products of agricultural origin.</p><br />

signs.title: PCBC S.A. LABEL OF COMPLIANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF ORGANIC FARMING
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded by the Polish Centre for Testing and Certification. It is the confirmation of compliance with requirements for organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The food product has been made in the agricultural production and agricultural and food processing conducted in accordance with European environmental standards, i.e. without the use of chemical pesticides and synthetic fertilizers.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products and products of agricultural origin</p><br />

signs.title: RAINFOREST ALLIANCE CERTIFIED SEAL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product is manufactured in accordance with the standards of sustainable agriculture (Sustainable Agriculture Network) and/or standards of responsible forestry (Forest Stewardship Council).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Manufacturing processes were carried out with respect for the environment and biodiversity in particular. The label also guarantees attention to social aspects related to the manufacture of a specific product, e.g. fair treatment of employees and their families who are guaranteed access to education and health care.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to products of agricultural and forest origin, e.g. food or wood packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: MILIEUKEUR ECOLABEL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product does not contain any or it contains very small amounts of pesticides and fertilizers.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Its manufacture was made in such a manner as to ensure the well-being of animals and environmental protection while complying with the principles of organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: EKO
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product contains more than 95% of organic ingredients manufactured in accordance with the principles of organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: BIOHELLAS
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Product with the label:<br />- is free from any harmful chemicals used in conventional agriculture<br />- has been manufactured in accordance with the criteria of organic farming, i.e. while maintaining biodiversity, taking care of the well-being of animals and without the use of mineral fertilizers.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is used for food products and products that contain ingredients of agricultural origin, e.g. textiles, cosmetics</p><br />

signs.title: AGRICULTURE BIOLOGIQUE (AB)
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product bearing this label contains at least in 95% organic ingredients produced in the European Union in accordance with the laws on organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: KRAV
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product bearing it is organic and has been manufactured without the use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides, while meeting the legal requirements provided for organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: BIO-SIEGEL
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Foods with the label are products of organic farming manufactured in controlled conditions that meet the standards of organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on agricultural products, especially food.</p><br />

signs.title: KNOW GOOD FOOD
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded by the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development. It aims to increase consumer&#39;s confidence in the product.<br />It informs on:<br />- high and stable quality of the food product<br />- excellent taste and health values.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Labelling is intended to help consumers in the selection of food and agricultural products that meet the highest criteria and have the highest commercial quality.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to food products.</p><br />

signs.title: BIODAR
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The mark is the label of organic farming used in the eco-labelling scheme in Slovenia. It means that products bearing it are organic and come from farms run in accordance with standards of the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movements (IFOAM).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Food products have been manufactured:<br />- in an environmentally friendly manner<br />- without the use of mineral fertilizers<br />- while preserving biodiversity<br />- while ensuring the well-being of animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is used for food products.</p><br />

signs.title: FAIRTRADE
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The aim of labelling is to care for workers from poor countries.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product with the label has been manufactured in the manner that ensures:<br />- compliance with the standards of the International Labour Organisation<br />- equal conditions for women and men<br />- fair compensation for employees<br />- environmental standards.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label can be awarded to any group of products. It can be found on packaging, food, cosmetics, textiles, construction materials, electronics and household appliances and toys.</p><br />

signs.title: ORGANIC FARMING
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label has been in force since 1 July 2010 as the official label of the European Union, which is awarded to products of agricultural origin complying with the EU legislation in organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label certifies that:<br />- the product bearing it meets the requirements of official supervision<br />- the product comes from certified organic farms<br />- at least 95% of product ingredients have been made by organic methods, i.e. in an environmentally friendly manner, without the use of mineral fertilizers, while preserving biodiversity and ensuring the well-being of animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The EU marking can be found on food products. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: ORGANIC FARMING
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label was in force until 1 July 2010 as the official label of the European Union, which was awarded to products of agricultural origin complying with the EU legislation in organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label certifies that:<br />- the product bearing it meets the requirements of official supervision<br />- the product comes from certified organic farms<br />- at least 95% of product ingredients have been made by organic methods, i.e. in an environmentally friendly manner, without the use of mineral fertilizers, while preserving biodiversity and ensuring the well-being of animals</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The EU marking can be found on food products. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: EKOLAND
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded by the association EKOLAND. It warranties that the product with the label is environmentally friendly. The product is manufactured in accordance with the criteria of the association, which correspond to (or even exceed) the requirements of the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movements (IFOAM) and are consistent with relevant regulations of the European Union in organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>A product with EKOLAND label has been manufactured in an environmentally friendly manner, without the use of mineral fertilizers, while observing the natural circulation of substances in nature and while maintaining the well-being of plants and animals. </p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on agricultural products, especially food. </p><br />

signs.title: CLIMATOP
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Due to the reduction of the emission of greenhouse gases, a given product or service is climate friendly, which makes it stand out in its product category. The label is awarded on the basis of the product life cycle analysis and comparison with other products.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be awarded to any group of products but most frequently you can find it on construction materials, cosmetics, textiles and electrical and electronic equipment.</p><br />

signs.title: CERTIFIED GREEN DEALER
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label indicates the membership to the programme of American sellers of construction materials, which is composed of a training system (on-line education) concerning environmental aspects of buildings and products.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to organisations operating in the construction industry.</p><br />

signs.title: CARBON NEUTRAL COMPANY
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is to confirm that the organisation (e.g. a manufacturer) has successfully completed the certification process conducted by the entity CARBON NEUTRAL.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The presence of the label proves that the organisation meets the standards stipulated in The CarbonNeutral Protocol and it has taken the initiative to mitigate its carbon footprint. This also means that the organisation has reduced its emissions of greenhouse gases into the environment and taken compensatory measures resulting in the fact that the carbon footprint of its operations is neutral (zero).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label is the guarantee of actions taken within an organisation for the benefit of environment, in particular in order to prevent global warming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to organisations for their activities aimed at neutralisation of the carbon footprint. In practice, it may be awarded to an organisation manufacturing any products or providing any services.</p><br />

signs.title: BRE GLOBAL CERTIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFILE
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label guarantees that the product or civil structure comply with comprehensive environmental criteria developed by the organisation BRE.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Product or item bearing the label demonstrates distinctive environmental performance as compared to similar products belonging to the same product/item category.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label certifies not only construction materials but also civil constructions. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: BASF ECO-EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded by the company BASF to products that successfully pass a comprehensive assessment of eco-efficiency, taking into account environmental, economic and social criteria. The assessment covers the entire product life cycle: from extraction of raw materials, through production and use, to the final management.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product or service bearing it is not only environmentally friendly, but it also demonstrates effectiveness in economic and social terms.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label is awarded to different groups of products, including construction materials and buildings, cosmetics, pharmaceutics, packaging and means of transport.</p><br />

signs.title: ABNT
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label guarantees that the product complies with comprehensive environmental criteria developed by the organisation ABNT concerning its entire life cycle.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Products with this label demonstrate distinctive environmental performance as compared to similar products belonging to the same product category.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>You can find the label on construction materials, cosmetics, textiles and electrical and electronic equipment. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: CARBON FOOTPRINT
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded by the organisation Carbon Trust. It means that for a carbon footprint analysis was performed for a given product or service. The label informs on the volume of greenhouse gas emission attributable to a part or the entire life cycle of a given product or service.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label ensures that carbon footprint calculations have been made in accordance with the guidance of the organisation Carbon Trust and applicable standards. The figure presented on the label means the amount of greenhouse gas emissions equivalent to carbon dioxide (CO2 eq) and it is expressed in mass units (grams, kilograms, tonnes).</p><br /><br /><p><strong>It is good to know</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Greenhouse gases are considered to be the major source of global warming, thus, the lower the carbon footprint value (lower numerical value in the label), the better it is for the environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label can be awarded to any group of products, including packaging.</p><br />

signs.title: EU ECOLABEL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The official environmental label functioning in the EU eco-labelling system.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The presence of the label on the product or its packaging means that it has complied with comprehensive - specific for its product category - environmental criteria concerning the entire life cycle. It is awarded to products and services demonstrating comprehensive environmental performance.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>It  is awarded to a broad range of products and services, including cosmetics, construction materials, textile products, toys, electrical and electronic equipment, detergents, paper products and fertilizers. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: THE BLUE ANGEL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is functioning in the German eco-labelling system.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to products that stand out in their product category by being:<br />- more friendly for the environment and human health<br />- significantly beneficial for the environment<br />- compliant with applicable standards of technical efficiency and requirements relating to occupational safety, health and hygiene.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label is awarded to a broad group of products including: construction materials, textile products, toys, electrical and electronic equipment, household articles, chemicals, heating systems and means of transport. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: NORDIC ECOLABEL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label functioning in the Nordic eco-labelling system in such countries as: Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark and Iceland.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label is awarded to products that stand out in their product category by being more friendly to the environment and human health, for example through lower consumption of energy, lower emission of pollutants or smaller volume of waste generated.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>It is awarded to a broad group of products: construction materials, textile products, toys, electrical and electronic equipment, household articles and cleaning agents. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: IHTK
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product has not been tested on animals at any production stage. It contains ingredients derived only from living animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: LEAPING BUNNY
signs.body: <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product and its ingredients have not been tested on animals.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on packaging.This label is placed mainly on cosmetics, but it can be also found on electrical and electronic equipment (household appliances) and household products, such as cleaning agents. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: NATRUE ORGANIC COSMETICS
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Organic Cosmetics label is awarded by the organisation NATRUE to organic cosmetics.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label guarantees that the product meets the requirements of the organisation NATRUE for natural cosmetics. In addition, this label ensures that at least 95% of the natural product ingredients come from controlled organic farming or controlled, so-called wild crops. Currently, very few cosmetics are able to meet these stringent requirements, which constitute a real challenge for manufacturers.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: NATRUE NATURAL COSMETICS WITH ORGANIC PORTION
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Natural Cosmetics with Organic Portion label is awarded by the organisation NATRUE to natural cosmetics that also contain some quantity of organic ingredients.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label guarantees that the product meets the requirements of the organisation NATRUE for natural cosmetics. In addition, this label ensures that at least 70% of the natural product ingredients come from controlled organic farming or controlled, so-called wild crops, which means that they are made with particular respect for the natural environment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: NATRUE NATURAL COSMETICS
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Natural Cosmetics mark is the basic label awarded to natural cosmetics by the organisation NATRUE, which specifies which ingredients and the method of their processing are allowed in the products that it certifies. In case of Natural Cosmetics labels, only natural ingredients may be used in cosmetics, which does not mean that they have to be derived from controlled organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Label guarantees that the product is made from natural ingredients with a low degree of processing, with respect for nature.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found on cosmetics and waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: ECO GARANTIE
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label indicates that the product bearing it has met the requirements for natural cosmetics with the addition of organic ingredients under Ecogarantie certification process.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product bearing it:<br />- contains a large amount of natural raw materials from controlled organic farming<br />- was not tested on animals<br />- is free from GMOs<br />-has been manufactured under the strict control concerning the use of stabilisers, emulsifiers, preservatives.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Generally, certification covers with the label three categories of products, such as: cosmetics, cleaning agents and sea salt. It can be also found on waste generated after the use of such products.</p><br />

signs.title: ECO CONTROL
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>This label indicates that the product bearing it has met the requirements for natural cosmetics with the addition of organic ingredients under EcoControl certification process.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product bearing it:<br />- contains ingredients made from natural raw materials<br />- is free from GMOs and derivatives of the petrochemical industry<br />- contains pure vegetable oils from controlled organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Certification includes food products and cosmetics.</p><br />

signs.title: VEGAN
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product was not tested on animals. It contains biodegradable and recyclable packaging.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product does not contain:<br />- synthetic preservatives<br />- substances derived from genetically modified plants<br />- synthetic fragrances and dyes.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>Certification includes food products and cosmetics.</p><br />

signs.title: ECO COSMEBIO
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product complies with the comprehensive criteria developed in 2002 concerning the manufacture of organic cosmetics, including the requirement that at least 95% of its ingredients are organic or derived from certified organic farming.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product bearing it is almost entirely based on natural raw materials, does not contain any synthetic colouring matters and odoriferous compounds, does not contain synthetic preservatives, such as paraben or fenoxyethanol, is free from GMOs and substances of petrochemical origin, and it was not subject to ionization treatment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found mainly on cosmetics and waste generated after the use of these products.</p><br />

signs.title: BIO COSMEBIO
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product complies with the comprehensive criteria developed in 2002 concerning the manufacture of natural cosmetics, including the requirement that at least 95% of its ingredients are natural or of natural origin.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product bearing it is almost entirely based on natural raw materials, does not contain any synthetic colouring matters and odoriferous compounds, does not contain synthetic preservatives, such as paraben or fenoxyethanol, is free from GMOs and substances of petrochemical origin, and it was not subject to ionization treatment.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found mainly on cosmetics and waste generated after the use of these products.</p><br />

signs.title: SOIL ASSOCIATION ORGANIC
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product contains the maximum possible amount of organic/ego components.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product bearing it is organic in 95% or - if there is an insufficient quantity of organic ingredients - organic in at least in 70% and then there is a note &quot;with organic ingredients&quot;. In addition, the label is a guarantee that the product is free from GMOs, often biodegradable and environmentally friendly.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found mainly on cosmetics, food products, textiles  and waste generated after the use of these products.</p><br />

signs.title: BDIH
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product contains plant raw materials derived from controlled organic farms and certified wild crops, which have been derived only from living animals. The product was not tested on animals and only compounds derived from selected natural substances were used for its production.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product does not contain:<br />- organic and synthetic colouring matters<br />- synthetic odoriferous substances<br />- substances obtained from the distillation of crude oil.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found mainly on cosmetics and food products and waste generated after the use of these products.</p><br />

signs.title: ECOCERT
signs.body: <p><strong>What does it mean?</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The product contains materials derived only from living animals. It was not tested on animals. Only compounds based on selected and non-hazardous substances were used as preservatives.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label guarantees that the product does not contain:<br />- Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs)<br />- substances obtained from the distillation of crude oil<br />- PEG emulsifiers<br />- synthetic odoriferous substances and colouring matters.<br />Ecocert warrants also that the product packaging is designed in an environmentally friendly manner.</p><br /><br /><p><strong>Where to find</strong></p><br /><br /><p>The label can be found mainly on cosmetics and food products and waste generated after the use of these products.</p><br />

signs.title: LABEL IDENTIFYING THE TYPE OF PACKAGING MATERIAL
